author: sky.cactus
content: I'm against a block gas limit increase right now.  I would be lobbying for a decrease if I thought I stood any chance of achieving it.  If people want cheaper transactions they *need* to move to layer 2.

author: yuga.eth
content: Hey all, I remember seeing somewhere two proposed schedules for the London hard fork - one targeting mainnet in July, and another targeting mainnet in August. Does anybody know what I'm talking about / know where I could find that?

author: trent_vanepps
content: personally, my position is to maintain the status quo. current increase will have negligible effect on gas prices, demand is unbounded

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Demanded quantity is a function of price. If we increase the supplied quantity,price should decrease a bit. Not claiming 20% increase will have a huge effect though

author: sky.cactus
content: I think you mean price should decrease a bit.

author: trent_vanepps
content: there are also confounding variables like Flashbots, which make it hard to measure the impact of a 2.5mm increase

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Yes of course :) (re @eth1x_bridge_bot: <Micah> I think you mean price should decrease a bit.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Yes, it may be difficult to measure such a minute change as it is probably much smaller than other effects (re @eth1x_bridge_bot: <Trent Van Epps> there are also confounding variables like Flashbots, which make it hard to measure the impact of a 2.5mm increase)
